raw_response:
Bsisa, when served, appears as a thick, uniform paste or dense porridge-like mixture rather than a soupy or stew consistency. It has a **brownish-beige color**, derived from roasted and ground wheat, barley, chickpeas, nuts, and spices. Typically, after mixing the powder with olive oil (and sometimes honey or sugar), it forms a somewhat sticky, pasty texture that holds together well but is not fully solid[1][4][5].
